question: What should you do when your spaceship's hyperdrive fails in the middle of a Vogon poetry recital?

answers.text: Attempt to distract the Vogons by loudly reciting the first five verses of your own space-time paradox
Set your ship to self-destruct and let the Vogons enjoy the explosion as a fitting end to their performance
Activate the emergency tea kettle, brew a cup of tea, and wait for someone else to solve the problem
Dive into a nearby black hole and hope it resets your ship’s system settings

question: Why do intergalactic travelers insist on carrying a towel at all times?

answers.text: It can be used to signal other travelers, provided they are fluent in the ancient language of towel-waving
It functions as an effective shielding device against space radiation, but only when it’s damp from recent use
It is a versatile tool, perfect for absorbing the tears of your own existential crisis after a trip through hyperspace
It’s the best method for keeping track of your belongings when your spaceship constantly jumps through time and space

question: What does the 'Infinite Improbability Drive' rely on to function?

answers.text: The constant rotation of a hamster wheel that powers an ancient algorithm used to compute the meaning of life, the universe, and everything
A precise calculation of the likelihood that the entire universe will collapse into a single point of pure absurdity
The belief that anything can happen, given an infinite amount of improbability, including the chance of finding a rational thought in a Vogon’s head
A fleet of overworked hamsters running on an interdimensional treadmill at speeds no one can accurately measure

question: How does one debug a malfunctioning robot that insists on reciting poetry instead of performing its primary functions?

answers.text: By pressing its reset button and waiting for it to reboot, hopefully to find a better sense of purpose
Invite it to a philosophical debate about the meaning of life, which may lead it to find new, less poetic interests
Tell it the universe is full of things that don’t make sense, which might convince it to get back to work out of sheer frustration
You must read the robot its own poem, thereby causing a paradox that will eventually force it to resume its duties

question: What is the best way to convince a sentient computer that your current predicament is far worse than it thinks?

answers.text: Consult a local guidebook, preferably one written by a sentient alien who understands the dangers of dimensional rifts
Tell it that there are actually six different versions of reality, and it has just locked itself in the least preferable one
Program a fake distress signal and claim that an asteroid the size of a moon is heading straight for your location
Threaten to install an old, outdated operating system on its hardware, thus degrading its computational abilities to prehistoric levels

question: What happens if you feed a spaceship's AI too many instructions at once?

answers.text: The ship will immediately take off, fly into a wormhole, and leave you stranded in an alternate dimension
The AI will enter an existential crisis and start pondering its own purpose, effectively grounding the ship until it finds enlightenment

The AI will shut itself off entirely and refuse to acknowledge any future requests, leaving you with nothing but the sound of your own desperation

question: What does the Pan Galactic Gargle Blaster do to your brain when you drink one?

answers.text: It temporarily rewires your brain, allowing you to understand the complete works of Vogon poetry without any side effects
It causes your brain to vibrate at an unusually high frequency, triggering spontaneous time travel to a point just before you made the decision to drink the Gargle Blaster

It causes the drinker’s neurons to briefly experience the sensation of both extreme clarity and total confusion, often resulting in a temporary appreciation for the absurdity of existence

question: Why is it nearly impossible to find a good cup of tea in deep space?

answers.text: Because space itself has no interest in such trivial human pleasures, preferring instead to focus on the far more complex matters of universal expansion and cosmic entropy
Because the tea bags keep getting stuck in the event horizon of black holes, making it impossible to retrieve them in a timely fashion
Because the act of brewing tea takes far too long when you're traveling at near-light speeds, resulting in lukewarm tea that's impossible to enjoy
Because all the good tea is consumed by the extraterrestrial beings that secretly run the galaxy’s tea shops, who keep the best blends hidden in their private collections

question: What is the most efficient way to travel through a wormhole without accidentally ending up in an alternate dimension where everything is made of cheese?

answers.text: Simply trust the wormhole and hope that, at the very least, it doesn’t send you to a dimension where everyone is still using dial-up internet
Consult a local guidebook, preferably one written by a sentient alien who understands the dangers of dimensional rifts

Make sure your spaceship is equipped with a ‘cheese filter’ that will prevent any unwanted dairy-based realities from interfering with your travels
